Audio.name: Audio
Audio.description:
The Audio tag plays audio and shows its waveform. Use for audio annotation tasks where you want to label regions of audio, see the waveform, and manipulate audio during annotation.

Use with the following data types: audio

value.name: value
value.description: Data field containing path or a URL to the audio.

defaultscale.name: defaultscale
defaultscale.description: Audio pane default y-scale for waveform.

defaultzoom.name: defaultzoom
defaultzoom.description: Default zoom level for waveform. (from 1 to 1500).

hotkey.name: hotkey
hotkey.description: Hotkey used to play or pause audio.

height.name: height
height.description: Total height of the audio player.

waveheight.name: waveheight
waveheight.description: Minimum height of a waveform when in `splitchannels` mode with multiple channels to display.

splitchannels.name: splitchannels
splitchannels.description: Display multiple audio channels separately, if the audio file has more than one channel. (**NOTE: Requires more memory to operate.**)

decoder.name: decoder
decoder.description: Decoder type to use to decode audio data. (`"webaudio"` or `"ffmpeg"`)

player.name: player
player.description: Player type to use to play audio data. (`"html5"` or `"webaudio"`)

HyperText.name: HyperText
HyperText.description:
The `HyperText` tag displays hypertext markup for labeling. Use for labeling HTML-encoded text and webpages for NER and NLP projects.

Use with the following data types: HTML.

valueType.name: valueType
valueType.description: Whether the text is stored directly in uploaded data or needs to be loaded from a URL

inline.name: inline
inline.description: Whether to embed HTML directly in Label Studio or use an iframe

saveTextResult.name: saveTextResult
saveTextResult.description: Whether to store labeled text along with the results. By default, doesn't store text for `valueType=url`

encoding.name: encoding
encoding.description: How to decode values from encoded strings

clickableLinks.name: clickableLinks
clickableLinks.description: Whether to allow opening resources from links in the hypertext markup.

highlightColor.name: highlightColor
highlightColor.description: Hex string with highlight color, if not provided uses the labels color

showLabels.name: showLabels
showLabels.description: Whether or not to show labels next to the region; unset (by default) — use editor settings; true/false — override settings

Image.name: Image
Image.description:
The `Image` tag shows an image on the page. Use for all image annotation tasks to display an image on the labeling interface.

Use with the following data types: images.

When you annotate image regions with this tag, the annotations are saved as percentages of the original size of the image, from 0-100.

value.name: value
value.description: Data field containing a path or URL to the image

smoothing.name: smoothing
smoothing.description: Enable smoothing, by default it uses user settings

zoom.name: zoom
zoom.description: Enable zooming an image with the mouse wheel

gridColor.name: gridColor
gridColor.description: Color of the grid in hex, opacity is 0.15

horizontalAlignment.name: horizontalAlignment
horizontalAlignment.description: Where to align image horizontally. Can be one of "left", "center" or "right"

verticalAlignment.name: verticalAlignment
verticalAlignment.description: Where to align image vertically. Can be one of "top", "center" or "bottom"

defaultZoom.name: defaultZoom
defaultZoom.description: Specify the initial zoom of the image within the viewport while preserving it’s ratio. Can be one of "auto", "original" or "fit"

valuelist.name: valuelist
valuelist.description: References a variable that holds a list of image URLs

crossOrigin.name: crossOrigin
crossOrigin.description: Configures CORS cross domain behavior for this image, either "none", "anonymous", or "use-credentials", similar to [DOM `img` crossOrigin property](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLImageElement/crossOrigin).

List.name: List
List.description:
The `List` tag is used to display a list of similar items like articles, search results, etc. Task data referred in `value` parameter should be an array of objects with `id`, `title`, and `body` fields.
It's much more lightweight than group of other tags like Text. And you can attach classification to provide additional data about this list.
Can be used with `Ranker` tag to rank items or pick relevant items from a list.
Items can be styled in `Style` tag by using `.htx-ranker-item` class.

value.name: value
value.description: Data field containing a JSON with array of objects (id, title, body) to rank

Paragraphs.name: Paragraphs
Paragraphs.description:
The `Paragraphs` tag displays paragraphs of text on the labeling interface. Use to label dialogue transcripts for NLP and NER projects.
The `Paragraphs` tag expects task data formatted as an array of objects like the following:
[{ $nameKey: "Author name", $textKey: "Text" }, ... ]

Use with the following data types: text.

value.name: value
value.description: Data field containing the paragraph content

valueType.name: valueType
valueType.description: Whether the data is stored directly in uploaded JSON data or needs to be loaded from a URL

showPlayer.name: showPlayer
showPlayer.description: Whether to show audio player above the paragraphs. Ignored if sync object is audio

saveTextResult.name: saveTextResult
saveTextResult.description: Whether to store labeled text along with the results. By default, doesn't store text for `valueType=url`

layout.name: layout
layout.description: Whether to use a dialogue-style layout or not

nameKey.name: nameKey
nameKey.description: The key field to use for name

textKey.name: textKey
textKey.description: The key field to use for the text

Table.name: Table
Table.description: The `Table` tag is used to display object keys and values in a table.

value.name: value
value.description: Data field value containing JSON type for Table

valueType.name: valueType
valueType.description: Value to define the data type in Table

Text.name: Text
Text.description:
The `Text` tag shows text that can be labeled. Use to display any type of text on the labeling interface.
You can use `<Style>.htx-text{ white-space: pre-wrap; }</Style>` to preserve all spaces in the text, otherwise spaces are trimmed when displayed.
Every space in the text sample is counted when calculating result offsets, for example for NER labeling tasks.

Use with the following data types: text.

value.name: value
value.description: Data field containing text or a UR

valueType.name: valueType
valueType.description: Whether the text is stored directly in uploaded data or needs to be loaded from a URL

saveTextResult.name: saveTextResult
saveTextResult.description: Whether to store labeled text along with the results. By default, doesn't store text for `valueType=url`

encoding.name: encoding
encoding.description: How to decode values from encoded strings

highlightColor.name: highlightColor
highlightColor.description: Hex string with highlight color, if not provided uses the labels color

showLabels.name: showLabels
showLabels.description: Whether or not to show labels next to the region; unset (by default) — use editor settings; true/false — override settings

TimeSeries.name: TimeSeries
TimeSeries.description:
The `TimeSeries` tag can be used to label time series data. Read more about Time Series Labeling on [the time series template page](../templates/time_series.html).

Note: The time axis in your data must be sorted, otherwise the TimeSeries tag does not work.
To use autogenerated indices as time axes, don't use the `timeColumn` parameter.

Use with the following data types: time series.

value.name: value
value.description: Key used to look up the data, either URLs for your time-series if valueType=url, otherwise expects JSON

valueType.name: valueType
valueType.description: Format of time series data provided. If set to "url" then Label Studio loads value references inside `value` key, otherwise it expects JSON.

timeColumn.name: timeColumn
timeColumn.description: Column name or index that provides temporal values. If your time series data has no temporal column then one is automatically generated.

timeFormat.name: timeFormat
timeFormat.description: Pattern used to parse values inside timeColumn, parsing is provided by d3, and follows `strftime` implementation

timeDisplayFormat.name: timeDisplayFormat
timeDisplayFormat.description: Format used to display temporal value. Can be a number or a date. If a temporal column is a date, use strftime to format it. If it's a number, use [d3 number](https://github.com/d3/d3-format#locale_format) formatting.

durationDisplayFormat.name: durationDisplayFormat
durationDisplayFormat.description: Format used to display temporal duration value for brush range. If the temporal column is a date, use strftime to format it. If it's a number, use [d3 number](https://github.com/d3/d3-format#locale_format) formatting.

overviewChannels.name: overviewChannels
overviewChannels.description: Comma-separated list of channel names or indexes displayed in overview.

overviewWidth.name: overviewWidth
overviewWidth.description: Default width of overview window in percents

fixedScale.name: fixedScale
fixedScale.description: Whether to scale y-axis to the maximum to fit all the values. If false, current view scales to fit only the displayed values.

Channel.name: Channel
Channel.description: Channel tag can be used to label time series data

displayFormat.name: displayFormat
displayFormat.description:
format string for the values, uses d3-format:
`[,][.precision][f\|%]`
`,` - group thousands with separator (from locale): `,` (12345.6 -> 12,345.6) `,.2f` (12345.6 -> 12,345.60)
`.precision` - precision for `f\|%` type, significant digits for empty type:
`.3f` (12.3456 -> 12.345, 1000 -> 1000.000)
`.3` (12.3456 -> 12.3, 1.2345 -> 1.23, 12345 -> 1.23e+4)
`f` - treat as float, default precision is .6: `f` (12 -> 12.000000) `.2f` (12 -> 12.00) `.0f` (12.34 -> 12)
`%` - treat as percents and format accordingly: `%.0` (0.128 -> 13%) `%.1` (1.2345 -> 123.4%)

strokeColor.name: strokeColor
strokeColor.description: plot stroke color, expects hex value

markerColor.name: markerColor
markerColor.description: plot stroke color, expects hex value

timeRange.name: timeRange
timeRange.description: data range of x-axis / time axis

dataRange.name: dataRange
dataRange.description: data range of y-axis / data axis

fixedScale.name: fixedScale
fixedScale.description: if false current view scales to fit only displayed values; if given overwrites TimeSeries' fixedScale

Video.name: Video
Video.description:
Video tag plays a simple video file. Use for video annotation tasks such as classification and transcription.

Use with the following data types: video

frameRate.name: frameRate
frameRate.description: video frame rate per second; default is 24; can use task data like `$fps`

Brush.name: Brush
Brush.description:
The `Brush` tag is used for image segmentation tasks where you want to apply a mask or use a brush to draw a region on the image.

Use with the following data types: image.

toName.name: toName
toName.description: Name of the image to label

choice.name: choice
choice.description: Configure whether the data labeler can select one or multiple labels

maxUsages.name: maxUsages
maxUsages.description: Maximum number of times a label can be used per task

showInline.name: showInline
showInline.description: Show labels in the same visual line

smart.name: smart
smart.description: Show smart tool for interactive pre-annotations

smartOnly.name: smartOnly
smartOnly.description: Only show smart tool for interactive pre-annotations

BrushLabels.name: BrushLabels
BrushLabels.description:
The `BrushLabels` tag for image segmentation tasks is used in the area where you want to apply a mask or use a brush to draw a region on the image.

Use with the following data types: image.

toName.name: toName
toName.description: Name of the image to label

choice.name: choice
choice.description: Configure whether the data labeler can select one or multiple labels

maxUsages.name: maxUsages
maxUsages.description: Maximum number of times a label can be used per task

showInline.name: showInline
showInline.description: Show labels in the same visual line

Choice.name: Choice
Choice.description:
The `Choice` tag represents a single choice for annotations. Use with the `Choices` tag or `Taxonomy` tag to provide specific choice options.

[^FF_DEV_2007]: `ff_dev_2007_rework_choices_280322_short` should be enabled to use `html` attribute
[^FF_PROD_309]: The `hint` attribute works only when `fflag_feat_front_prod_309_choice_hint_080523_short` is enabled

selected.name: selected
selected.description: Specify whether to preselect this choice on the labeling interface

alias.name: alias
alias.description: Alias for the choice. If used, the alias replaces the choice value in the annotation results. Alias does not display in the interface.

style.name: style
style.description: CSS style of the checkbox element

html.name: html
html.description: can be used to show enriched content[^FF_DEV_2007], it has higher priority than `value`, however `value` will be used in the exported result (should be properly escaped)

Choices.name: Choices
Choices.description:
The `Choices` tag is used to create a group of choices, with radio buttons or checkboxes. It can be used for single or multi-class classification. Also, it is used for advanced classification tasks where annotators can choose one or multiple answers.

Choices can have dynamic value to load labels from task. This task data should contain a list of options to create underlying `<Choice>`s. All the parameters from options will be transferred to corresponding tags.

The `Choices` tag can be used with any data types.

[^FF_LSDV_4583]: `fflag_feat_front_lsdv_4583_multi_image_segmentation_short` should be enabled for `perItem` functionality.
[^FF_DEV_2007_DEV_2008]: `ff_dev_2007_dev_2008_dynamic_tag_children_250322_short` should be enabled to use dynamic options.
[^FF_DEV_2007]: `ff_dev_2007_rework_choices_280322_short` should be enabled to use `html` attribute

name.name: name
name.description: Name of the group of choices

toName.name: toName
toName.description: Name of the data item that you want to label

showInline.name: showInline
showInline.description: Show choices in the same visual line

required.name: required
required.description: Validate whether a choice has been selected

requiredMessage.name: requiredMessage
requiredMessage.description: Show a message if validation fails

whenTagName.name: whenTagName
whenTagName.description: Use with visibleWhen. Narrow down visibility by name of the tag. For regions, use the name of the object tag, for choices, use the name of the choices tag

whenLabelValue.name: whenLabelValue
whenLabelValue.description: Narrow down visibility by label value

whenChoiceValue.name: whenChoiceValue
whenChoiceValue.description: Narrow down visibility by choice value

perRegion.name: perRegion
perRegion.description: Use this tag to select a choice for a specific region instead of the entire task

perItem.name: perItem
perItem.description: Use this tag to select a choice for a specific item inside the object instead of the whole object[^FF_LSDV_4583]

value.name: value
value.description: Task data field containing a list of dynamically loaded choices (see example below)[^FF_DEV_2007_DEV_2008]

allowNested.name: allowNested
allowNested.description: Allow to use `children` field in dynamic choices to nest them. Submitted result will contain array of arrays, every item is a list of values from topmost parent choice down to selected one.

DateTime.name: DateTime
DateTime.description:
The DateTime tag adds date and time selection to the labeling interface. Use this tag to add a date, timestamp, month, or year to an annotation.

Use with the following data types: audio, image, HTML, paragraph, text, time series, video

[^FF_LSDV_4583]: `fflag_feat_front_lsdv_4583_multi_image_segmentation_short` should be enabled for `perItem` functionality

toName.name: toName
toName.description: Name of the element that you want to label

only.name: only
only.description:
Comma-separated list of parts to display (date, time, month, year)
       date and month/year can't be used together. The date option takes precedence

format.name: format

min.name: min
min.description: Set a minimum datetime value for only=date in ISO format, or minimum year for only=year

max.name: max
max.description: Set a maximum datetime value for only=date in ISO format, or maximum year for only=year

required.name: required
required.description: Whether datetime is required or not

requiredMessage.name: requiredMessage
requiredMessage.description: Message to show if validation fails

perRegion.name: perRegion
perRegion.description: Use this option to label regions instead of the whole object

perItem.name: perItem
perItem.description: Use this option to label items inside the object instead of the whole object[^FF_LSDV_4583]

Ellipse.name: Ellipse
Ellipse.description:
The `Ellipse` tag is used to add an elliptical bounding box to an image. Use for bounding box image segmentation tasks with ellipses.

Use with the following data types: image.

toName.name: toName
toName.description: Name of the image to label

smart.name: smart
smart.description: Show smart tool for interactive pre-annotations

smartOnly.name: smartOnly
smartOnly.description: Only show smart tool for interactive pre-annotations

EllipseLabels.name: EllipseLabels
EllipseLabels.description:
The `EllipseLabels` tag creates labeled ellipses. Use to apply labels to ellipses for semantic segmentation.

Use with the following data types: image.

toName.name: toName
toName.description: Name of the image to label

choice.name: choice
choice.description: Configure whether you can select one or multiple labels

maxUsages.name: maxUsages
maxUsages.description: Maximum number of times a label can be used per task

showInline.name: showInline
showInline.description: Show labels in the same visual line

HyperTextLabels.name: HyperTextLabels
HyperTextLabels.description:
The `HyperTextLabels` tag creates labeled hyper text (HTML). Use with the HyperText object tag to annotate HTML text or HTML elements for named entity recognition tasks.

Use with the following data types: HTML.

toName.name: toName
toName.description: Name of the HTML element to label

choice.name: choice
choice.description: Configure if you can select one or multiple labels

maxUsages.name: maxUsages
maxUsages.description: Maximum number of times a label can be used per task

showInline.name: showInline
showInline.description: Show labels in the same visual line

KeyPoint.name: KeyPoint
KeyPoint.description:
The `KeyPoint` tag is used to add a key point to an image without selecting a label. This can be useful when you have only one label to assign to the key point.

Use with the following data types: image.

toName.name: toName
toName.description: Name of the image to label

smart.name: smart
smart.description: Show smart tool for interactive pre-annotations

smartOnly.name: smartOnly
smartOnly.description: Only show smart tool for interactive pre-annotations

KeyPointLabels.name: KeyPointLabels
KeyPointLabels.description:
The `KeyPointLabels` tag creates labeled keypoints. Use to apply labels to identified key points, such as identifying facial features for a facial recognition labeling project.

Use with the following data types: image.

toName.name: toName
toName.description: Name of the image to label

choice.name: choice
choice.description: Configure whether you can select one or multiple labels

maxUsages.name: maxUsages
maxUsages.description: Maximum number of times a label can be used per task

showInline.name: showInline
showInline.description: Show labels in the same visual line

Label.name: Label
Label.description: The `Label` tag represents a single label. Use with the `Labels` tag, including `BrushLabels`, `EllipseLabels`, `HyperTextLabels`, `KeyPointLabels`, and other `Labels` tags to specify the value of a specific label.

maxUsages.name: maxUsages
maxUsages.description: Maximum number of times this label can be used per task

hotkey.name: hotkey
hotkey.description: Hotkey to use for the label. Automatically generated if not specified

showAlias.name: showAlias
showAlias.description: Whether to show alias inside label text

size.name: size
size.description: Size of text in the label

background.name: background
background.description: Background color of an active label in hexadecimal

selectedColor.name: selectedColor
selectedColor.description: Color of text in an active label in hexadecimal

granularity.name: granularity
granularity.description: Set control based on symbol or word selection (only for Text)

html.name: html
html.description: HTML code is used to display label button instead of raw text provided by `value` (should be properly escaped)

Labels.name: Labels
Labels.description:
The `Labels` tag provides a set of labels for labeling regions in tasks for machine learning and data science projects. Use the `Labels` tag to create a set of labels that can be assigned to identified region and specify the values of labels to assign to regions.

All types of Labels can have dynamic value to load labels from task. This task data should contain a list of options to create underlying `<Label>`s. All the parameters from options will be transferred to corresponding tags.

The Labels tag can be used with audio and text data types. Other data types have type-specific Labels tags.

toName.name: toName
toName.description: Name of the element that you want to label

choice.name: choice
choice.description: Configure whether you can select one or multiple labels for a region

maxUsages.name: maxUsages
maxUsages.description: Maximum number of times a label can be used per task

showInline.name: showInline
showInline.description: Whether to show labels in the same visual line

opacity.name: opacity
opacity.description: Opacity of rectangle highlighting the label

value.name: value
value.description: Task data field containing a list of dynamically loaded labels (see example below)

Magicwand.name: Magicwand
Magicwand.description:
The `Magicwand` tag makes it possible to click in a region of an image a user is doing segmentation
labeling on, drag the mouse to dynamically change flood filling tolerance, then release the mouse button
to get a new labeled area. It is particularly effective at segmentation labeling broad, diffuse, complex
edged objects, such as clouds, cloud shadows, snow, etc. in earth observation applications or organic
shapes in biomedical applications.

Use with the following data types: image.

Zooming is supported for the Magic Wand, but it will not work on rotated images.

Example of the Magic Wand in use:

![Animated GIF showing Magic Wand clicking on cloud and dragging, automatically segmenting and selecting
pixels to create a mask](../images/magicwand_example.gif)

### Feature Flag

The Magic Wand is currently turned off by default behind a feature flag. If you want to turn it on, you
must enable it by either:
- Setting an environment variable when starting the Label Studio server, either by starting up the
  server with `fflag_feat_front_dev_4081_magic_wand_tool=1 label-studio`, or manually finding the flag
`flag_feat_front_dev_4081_magic_wand_tool` and setting it to true.

### CORS Configuration

The Magic Wand requires pixel-level access to images that are being labelled in order to do its
thresholding and flood filling. If you are hosting your images to label on a third-party domain,
you will need to enable CORS headers for the Magic Wand to work with cross domain HTTP `GET`
requests in order for the Magic Wand to be able to threshold the actual image pixel data. See the
[Label Studio storage guide](../guide/storage.html#Troubleshoot-CORS-and-access-problems) for more
details on configuring CORS.

### `Image` Tag Configuration

The `Magicwand` tag is configured to work with an `Image` tag that it will operate on for labeling.
If you are storing an image cross-domain that the `Image` tag will reference, you will have to
correctly setup the `crossOrigin` on the `Image` attribute. This attribute mimics the same
`crossOrigin` attribute that a normal DOM `img` tag would
have ([reference])(https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLImageElement/crossOrigin).

If the image is on a public server or Google/AWS/Azure bucket that is publicly readable
without any authentication, you should set `crossOrigin` to `anonymous`.

If the image is on a server or a private cloud bucket that requires authentication of any
kind (i.e. the request must have HTTP headers that prove authentication set along with the
third party request), then you should set `crossOrigin` to `use-credentials`. Note that Google's
cloud buckets [do not support authenticated requests for CORS requests](https://cloud.google.com/storage/docs/cross-origin#additional_considerations),
which  means you either need to make that Google bucket world readable to work with the Magic Wand, or
use Label Studio's signed URL support ([AWS](../guide/storage.html#Set-up-connection-in-the-Label-Studio-UI),
[GCP](../guide/storage.html#Set-up-connection-in-the-Label-Studio-UI-1), and
[Azure](../guide/storage.html#Set-up-connection-in-the-Label-Studio-UI-2)).

If the image is on the same host as your Label Studio instance, you can simply leave off the
`crossOrigin` attribute or set it to `none`.

toName.name: toName
toName.description: Name of the image to label

opacity.name: opacity
opacity.description: Opacity of the Magic Wand region during use

blurradius.name: blurradius
blurradius.description: The edges of a Magic Wand region are blurred and simplified, this is the radius of the blur kernel

defaultthreshold.name: defaultthreshold
defaultthreshold.description: When the user initially clicks without dragging, how far a color has to be from the initial selected pixel to also be selected

Number.name: Number
Number.description:
The Number tag supports numeric classification. Use to classify tasks using numbers.

Use with the following data types: audio, image, HTML, paragraphs, text, time series, video

[^FF_LSDV_4583]: `fflag_feat_front_lsdv_4583_multi_image_segmentation_short` should be enabled for `perItem` functionality

toName.name: toName
toName.description: Name of the element that you want to label

defaultValue.name: defaultValue
defaultValue.description: Default number value; will be added automatically to result for required fields

requiredMessage.name: requiredMessage
requiredMessage.description: Message to show if validation fails

perRegion.name: perRegion
perRegion.description: Use this tag to classify specific regions instead of the whole object

perItem.name: perItem
perItem.description: Use this tag to classify specific items inside the object instead of the whole object[^FF_LSDV_4583]

slider.name: slider
slider.description: Use slider look instead of input; use min and max to add your constraints

Pairwise.name: Pairwise
Pairwise.description:
The `Pairwise` tag is used to compare two different objects and select one item from the list. If you want annotators to compare two objects and determine whether they are similar or not, use the `Choices` tag.

Use with the following data types: audio, image, HTML, paragraphs, text, time series, video.

toName.name: toName
toName.description: Comma-separated names of the elements you want to compare

ParagraphLabels.name: ParagraphLabels
ParagraphLabels.description:
The `ParagraphLabels` tag creates labeled paragraphs. Use with the `Paragraphs` tag to label a paragraph of text.

Use with the following data types: paragraphs.

toName.name: toName
toName.description: Name of the paragraph element to label

choice.name: choice
choice.description: Configure whether you can select one or multiple labels

maxUsages.name: maxUsages
maxUsages.description: Maximum number of times a label can be used per task

showInline.name: showInline
showInline.description: Show labels in the same visual line

Polygon.name: Polygon
Polygon.description:
The `Polygon` tag is used to add polygons to an image without selecting a label. This can be useful when you have only one label to assign to the polygon. Use for image segmentation tasks.

Use with the following data types: image.

fillColor.name: fillColor
fillColor.description: Polygon fill color in hexadecimal or HTML color name

smart.name: smart
smart.description: Show smart tool for interactive pre-annotations

smartOnly.name: smartOnly
smartOnly.description: Only show smart tool for interactive pre-annotations

PolygonLabels.name: PolygonLabels
PolygonLabels.description:
The `PolygonLabels` tag is used to create labeled polygons. Use to apply labels to polygons in semantic segmentation tasks.

Use with the following data types: image.

toName.name: toName
toName.description: Name of image to label

choice.name: choice
choice.description: Configure whether you can select one or multiple labels

maxUsages.name: maxUsages
maxUsages.description: Maximum number of times a label can be used per task

showInline.name: showInline
showInline.description: Show labels in the same visual line

Ranker.name: Ranker
Ranker.description:
The `Ranker` tag is used to rank items in a `List` tag or pick relevant items from a `List`, depending on using nested `Bucket` tags.
In simple case of `List` + `Ranker` tags the first one becomes interactive and saved result is a dict with the only key of tag's name and with value of array of ids in new order.
With `Bucket`s any items from the `List` can be moved to these buckets, and resulting groups will be exported as a dict `{ bucket-name-1: [array of ids in this bucket], ... }`
By default all items will sit in `List` and will not be exported, unless they are moved to a bucket. But with `default="true"` parameter you can specify a bucket where all items will be placed by default, so exported result will always have all items from the list, grouped by buckets.
Columns and items can be styled in `Style` tag by using respective `.htx-ranker-column` and `.htx-ranker-item` classes. Titles of columns are defined in `title` parameter of `Bucket` tag.
Note: When `Bucket`s used without `default` param, the original list will also be stored as "_" named column in results, but that's internal value and this may be changed later.

toName.name: toName
toName.description: List tag name to connect to

Rating.name: Rating
Rating.description:
The `Rating` tag adds a rating selection to the labeling interface. Use for labeling tasks involving ratings.

Use with the following data types: audio, image, HTML, paragraphs, text, time series, video.

[^FF_LSDV_4583]: `fflag_feat_front_lsdv_4583_multi_image_segmentation_short` should be enabled for `perItem` functionality

toName.name: toName
toName.description: Name of the element that you want to label

requiredMessage.name: requiredMessage
requiredMessage.description: Message to show if validation fails

perRegion.name: perRegion
perRegion.description: Use this tag to rate regions instead of the whole object

perItem.name: perItem
perItem.description: Use this tag to rate items inside the object instead of the whole object[^FF_LSDV_4583]

Rectangle.name: Rectangle
Rectangle.description:
The `Rectangle` tag is used to add a rectangle (Bounding Box) to an image without selecting a label. This can be useful when you have only one label to assign to a rectangle.

Use with the following data types: image.

toName.name: toName
toName.description: Name of the image to label

canRotate.name: canRotate
canRotate.description: Whether to show or hide rotation control

smart.name: smart
smart.description: Show smart tool for interactive pre-annotations

smartOnly.name: smartOnly
smartOnly.description: Only show smart tool for interactive pre-annotations

RectangleLabels.name: RectangleLabels
RectangleLabels.description:
The `RectangleLabels` tag creates labeled rectangles. Use to apply labels to bounding box semantic segmentation tasks.

Use with the following data types: image.

toName.name: toName
toName.description: Name of the image to label

choice.name: choice
choice.description: Configure whether you can select one or multiple labels

maxUsages.name: maxUsages
maxUsages.description: Maximum number of times a label can be used per task

showInline.name: showInline
showInline.description: Show labels in the same visual line

Relation.name: Relation
Relation.description: The `Relation` tag represents a single relation label. Use with the `Relations` tag to specify the value of a label to apply to a relation between regions.

background.name: background
background.description: Background color of the active label in hexadecimal

Relations.name: Relations
Relations.description:
The `Relations` tag is used to create label relations between regions. Use to provide many values to apply to the relationship between two labeled regions.

Use with the following data types: audio, image, HTML, paragraphs, text, time series, video.

choice.name: choice
choice.description: Configure whether you can select one or multiple labels

Shortcut.name: Shortcut
Shortcut.description:
The `Shortcut` tag to define a shortcut that annotators can use to add a predefined object, such as a specific label value, with a hotkey or keyboard shortcut.

Use with the following data types:
- Audio
- Image
- HTML
- Paragraphs
- Text
- Time series
- Video

Taxonomy.name: Taxonomy
Taxonomy.description:
The `Taxonomy` tag is used to create one or more hierarchical classifications, storing both choice selections and their ancestors in the results. Use for nested classification tasks with the `Choice` tag.

Use with the following data types: audio, image, HTML, paragraphs, text, time series, video.

[^FF_LSDV_4583]: `fflag_feat_front_lsdv_4583_multi_image_segmentation_short` should be enabled for `perItem` functionality

toName.name: toName
toName.description: Name of the element that you want to classify

leafsOnly.name: leafsOnly
leafsOnly.description: Allow annotators to select only leaf nodes of taxonomy

showFullPath.name: showFullPath
showFullPath.description: Whether to show the full path of selected items

pathSeparator.name: pathSeparator
pathSeparator.description: Separator to show in the full path

maxUsages.name: maxUsages
maxUsages.description: Maximum number of times a choice can be selected per task

requiredMessage.name: requiredMessage
requiredMessage.description: Message to show if validation fails

placeholder=.name: placeholder=
placeholder=.description: What to display as prompt on the input

perRegion.name: perRegion
perRegion.description: Use this tag to classify specific regions instead of the whole object

perItem.name: perItem
perItem.description: Use this tag to classify specific items inside the object instead of the whole object[^FF_LSDV_4583]

TextArea.name: TextArea
TextArea.description:
The `TextArea` tag is used to display a text area for user input. Use for transcription, paraphrasing, or captioning tasks.

Use with the following data types: audio, image, HTML, paragraphs, text, time series, video.

[^FF_LSDV_4659]: `fflag_feat_front_lsdv_4659_skipduplicates_060323_short` should be enabled to use `skipDuplicates` attribute
[^FF_LSDV_4712]: `fflag_feat_front_lsdv_4712_skipduplicates_editing_110423_short` should be enabled to keep submissions unique during editing existed results
[^FF_LSDV_4583]: `fflag_feat_front_lsdv_4583_multi_image_segmentation_short` should be enabled for `perItem` functionality

toName.name: toName
toName.description: Name of the element that you want to label

editable.name: editable
editable.description: Whether to display an editable textarea

skipDuplicates.name: skipDuplicates
skipDuplicates.description: Prevent duplicates in textarea inputs[^FF_LSDV_4659][^FF_LSDV_4712] (see example below)

rows.name: rows
rows.description: Number of rows in the textarea

required.name: required
required.description: Validate whether content in textarea is required

requiredMessage.name: requiredMessage
requiredMessage.description: Message to show if validation fails

showSubmitButton.name: showSubmitButton
showSubmitButton.description: Whether to show or hide the submit button. By default it shows when there are more than one rows of text, such as in textarea mode.

perRegion.name: perRegion
perRegion.description: Use this tag to label regions instead of whole objects

perItem.name: perItem
perItem.description: Use this tag to label items inside objects instead of whole objects[^FF_LSDV_4583]

TimeSeriesLabels.name: TimeSeriesLabels
TimeSeriesLabels.description:
The `TimeSeriesLabels` tag is used to create a labeled time range.

Use with the following data types: time series.

toname.name: toname
toname.description: Name of the timeseries to label

choice.name: choice
choice.description: Configure whether you can select one or multiple labels

maxUsages.name: maxUsages
maxUsages.description: Maximum number of times a label can be used per task

showInline.name: showInline
showInline.description: Show labels in the same visual line

fillColor.name: fillColor
fillColor.description: Range fill color in hexadecimal or HTML color name

VideoRectangle.name: VideoRectangle
VideoRectangle.description:
VideoRectangle tag brings Object Tracking capabilities to videos. It works in combination with the `<Video/>` and the `<Labels/>` tags.

Use with the following data types: video

toName.name: toName
toName.description: Name of the element to control (video)

Collapse.name: Collapse
Collapse.description: Collapse tag, a content area which can be collapsed and expanded.

Filter.name: Filter
Filter.description: Use the Filter tag to add a filter search for a large number of labels or choices. Use with the Labels tag or Choices tag.

hotkey.name: hotkey
hotkey.description: Hotkey to use to focus on the filter text area

Header.name: Header
Header.description: The `Header` tag is used to show a header on the labeling interface.

value.name: value
value.description: Text of header, either static text or the field name in data to use for the header

size.name: size
size.description: Level of header on a page, used to control size of the text

Style.name: Style
Style.description: The `Style` tag is used in combination with the View tag to apply custom CSS properties to the labeling interface. See the [CSS Reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/Reference) on the MDN page for a full list of available properties that you can reference. You can also adjust default Label Studio CSS classes. Use the browser developer tools to inspect the element on the UI and locate the class name, then specify that class name in the `Style` tag.

`.<className>`.name: `.<className>`
`.<className>`.description: Reference the className specified in the View tag to apply to a section of the labeling configuration.

CSS property.name: CSS property
CSS property.description: CSS property and value to apply.

View.name: View
View.description: The `View` element is used to configure the display of blocks, similar to the div tag in HTML.

className.name: className
className.description: Class name of the CSS style to apply. Use with the Style tag

visibleWhen.name: visibleWhen
visibleWhen.description: Show the contents of a view when condition is true

whenTagName.name: whenTagName
whenTagName.description: Narrow down visibility by tag name. For regions, use the name of the object tag, for choices, use the name of the choices tag.

whenLabelValue.name: whenLabelValue
whenLabelValue.description: Narrow down visibility by label value

whenChoiceValue.name: whenChoiceValue
whenChoiceValue.description: Narrow down visibility by choice value
